name: hcmid-edd
tagline: Scholarly editions created by the Holy Cross Manuscripts, Inscriptions and Documents Club
body:
# Scholarly editions from the Holy Cross Manuscripts, Inscriptions and Documents Club#

This is a repository for notes about the scholarly editions being developed
by the [Holy Cross Manuscripts, Inscriptions and Documents Club][hcmid].

[hcmid]: http://shot.holycross.edu/hcmid/

All archival work is managed using `git` repositories.  Here are links to repositories 
on github for club projects in the fall of 2013:

- [Geneva Lat.MS. 49][gen49], Jerome's *Chronicles*
- [St. Gallen, Vadianische Sammlung 298][vs298], Jerome's *Chronicles*
- [Primary sources for teaching introductory Latin][latinsrcs]
- [Texts of Archimedes][archhc]
- [Classical Athenian epigraphic documents related to tribute][phoros]
- [Codex Bodmer 48][cb48], Chaucer's *Canterbury Tales*
- [Manuscripts with musical notation using neumes][chant]
- As part of the Homer Multitext project
    - [*Iliad* 10][il10] in the Venetus A and Escorial Upsilon 1.1 MSS
    - [*Iliad* 22][il22]  in the Venetus A and Escorial Upsilon 1.1 MSS

[chant]: http://neelsmith.github.io/chant/

[latinsrcs]: http://neelsmith.github.io/latinsrcs/

[gen49]: http://neelsmith.github.io/gen49/

[vs298]: http://neelsmith.github.io/vadslg298/

[archhc]: http://neelsmith.github.io/archimedes-hc/

[phoros]: http://neelsmith.github.io/phoros/

[cb48]: http://neelsmith.github.io/cb48/

[il10]: https://github.com/neelsmith/hmt-iliad10

[il22]: https://github.com/neelsmith/hmt-iliad22
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
